results.title: The Lady from Grey County
results.creator_credit: Janice H Brown, Margaret Wescott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: On March 8, 1922, Agnes Campbell Macphail became Canada’s first woman Member of Parliament. For the next nineteen years, the Independent MP used her wit, courage and honesty to fight for prison reform, old-age pensions, the co-operative movement and the many other causes she believed in. Made up of old photographs, archival footage and quotations from her speeches and writings, this film documents a significant Canadian and the turbulence of her times. Agnes Campbell Macphail died on February 13, 1954.

results.title: The Lady Eve [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Preston Sturges, Paul Jones and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Henry Fonda is a millionaire scientist who is obsessed by snakes. Barbara Stanwyck is the fearless gambler and hustler whose only phobia is reptiles. When they meet on an ocean liner in Latin America, the scene is set for one of Hollywood’s classiest, most electric and funniest of romantic screwball comedies. The dour serious Fonda is a delightful foil to Stanwyck’s vivacious smart-talking Eve. William Demarest plays Fonda’s cynical wary man-servant who does his best to keep Eve away from the innocent Fonda. But Eve has lots of tricks up her sleeve. The effortless charm of this movie is a testament to the wry comic talents of Preston Sturges. Whereas Ernst Lubitsch’s legacy to romantic comedy was a highly stylised European elegance, Sturges took Lubitsch’s blue-print and invested it with American physicality and vigor. The eroticism of the charge between Stanwyck and Fonda is earthy and tangible. The fast script is full of great one-liners, the costumes by Edith Head are delightful, and the supporting cast include some of Hollywood’s finest comic character actors. Watch out for the excellent animated title sequence at the beginning of the movie.

results.title: The Lady and the owl
results.creator_credit: William Canning, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: From all over Canada people bring injured owls to Kate and Larry McKeevers of Ontario who have devoted the past ten years of their lives to the care of the species. Mrs McKeevers, in particular, is fascinated by them and explains their habits and anatomy. (Award: Columbus)

results.title: The Ladies sing the blues
results.brief_description: The dramatized life story of legendary songstress Billie Holliday. Containing film footage of the real Holliday, this documentary also offers rare clips of such blues greats as Dinah Washington, Bessie Smith, Lena Horne, Peggy Lee and Sarah Vaughn. Each performer is seen in her prime, backed up by such instrumental talent as Coleman Hawkins, Lester Young and Ben Webster. Includes footage of performances once considered lost.

results.title: The Ladies man
results.creator_credit: Jerry Lewis, Paramount Pictures and York Pictures
results.brief_description: This comedy starring Jerry Lewis (his third directorial effort) is set in an all female boarding house, brimming with sex-starved women. Lewis plays Herbert H. Herbert, a university graduate sworn off love whilst mourning the break-up of a relationship, who takes a job as house boy. As well as being in charge of repairs, the fumbling Herbert has to deal with being the lone male presence amid so many nubile beauties. The house itself, a multilayered set built at enormous cost, is an impressive and colourful piece that at times dwarfs the star and the patchy narrative. Typically, several musical interludes pepper the action, allowing for some imaginative moments of dance and song. Characteristically for a Lewis comedy, the talented comedian is given free reign to display his brand of silly, goofy and slapstick physical humour, highlighting his penchant for physical idiocy and facial expressiveness. Cast includes Helen Traubel, Kathleen Freeman, Hope Holiday, Mary Laroche and Madlyn Rhue.

results.title: The Ladies' man; Lord Byron lived here; The Lift
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hancock’s half hour”.
Three episodes from the British television comedy series “Hancock” starring Tony Hancock. 1. The Ladies man: Hancock decides to take things into his own hands and improve his success rate with the opposite sex. 2. Lord Byron lives here: The discovery of scribblings by the great poet Byron leads Hancock to open his house as a stately home, exploit the American tourists and make a fortune at the same time. The Lift: What a captive audience has top put up with when Hancock tips the balance of one too many in the lift and the lift won’t budge.

results.title: The Lacemaker = La Dentelliere
results.creator_credit: Claude Goretta, Yves Gasser, Yves Peyrot, Citel Films, Filmproduktion Janus and Action Films
results.brief_description: Pomme works as a hairdresser and lives with her protective mother in Paris. She goes on a holiday to the seaside town of Cabourg with a more worldly friend. There she forms a relationship with Francois, a young student, and they decide to live together in Paris. Social differences soon emerge. While Francois is garrulously intellectual, Pomme is reserved, incapable of communicating with Francois and his friends but maintaining a mysterious inner radiance. Goretta has described his film as “a genre painting” in narrative form and it is constructed in a series of brief fragmentary scenes which form a picture without evident narrative connections. With its narrative ellipses - eloquent silences and observation of Pomme’s mysterious inner life - Goretta’s film resembles Bresson’s “Une Femme Douce”. Cast includes Isabelle Huppert, Yves Benneyton, Florence Giorgetti, and Anne-Marie Duringer. Based on the novel by Pascal Laine. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Kunlun Column = Wei Wei Kun Lun
results.creator_credit: Sheng Dong, Jin Mu-Kui and August First Film Studio
results.brief_description:
This film is focused on retelling the stories of Mao Zedong’s honourable leadership throughout a number of battles between the Communist and Nationalist parties in China. The opening sequence depicts Mao speaking in front of the Communist Party, reporting that the leader of the Nationalist Party, Chiang Kai-Shek, has violated the peace treaty in place between the two parties. Mao presumes that this means the Nationalist Party will soon attack yet strongly claims that he will persevere through all of the pressure of war.
The following scene shows Yan’an, the city that Mao is residing in, being hit by a surprise attack led by Chiang Kai-Shek and his army. First the city is bombed by an air raid and then it is overrun by thousands of foot soldiers. All of the villagers retreat, abandoning their burning houses after the bombings. Mao asserts that he will not leave the city until he knows for certain that the rest of the city’s population has safely evacuated, although eventually he is persuaded. Chiang Kai-Shek’s army successfully conquered Ya’nan.
Mao Zedong and his four closest advisors decide to form a secret group and devise a plan to outsmart Chiang Kai-Shek and defeat the Nationalist Party. The name of the secret group is the Kunlun Column. Their plan is to divide their forces into four separate groups, sending Mao with one of them in an attempt to relocate him to a safer location. Mao joins his troops and embarks on a vast journey through the mountains and across extremely rough terrain. He is depicted as an equal to his soldiers and is shown walking and socialising with all ranks of his army.
Chiang Kai-Shek decides to buy extremely technologically advanced war instruments from the US government officials and uses them to locate exactly where Mao is and determine where he is going. The equipment informs the Nationalist Party that Mao and his followers are heading towards Russia to seek shelter from the applied communist forces led by Joseph Stalin. The Nationalists immediately send their highly trained army named ‘Division 36’ to capture Mao.
The Nationalist army travel through the harsh conditions of the desert and when they make it to the other side they are absolutely exhausted. They plan a large-scale sneak attack but even after their fervent tracking efforts are unable to locate the communist army. Mao and his army are strategically hiding in the mountain ranges and when they see the Nationalist Party lurking directionless, they launch an organised and vicious attack that completely wipes out the notorious ‘Division 36’. Mao and his followers rejoice in their landslide victory over the Nationalist army.
After the battle the members of the Kunlum Column no longer need to conceal their identity and come out of hiding. They meet with Mao at a Buddhist temple and are thrilled to be reunited. At the temple Mao draws a stick from a monk that is said to predict the future – the stick reads “most lucky”. Mao plans his next major attack against Chang Kai-Shek but is very content at have reclaimed so much land after their latest victory – which was all thanks to the courage and superior intellect of the Kunlun Column.
(Haydn Green 2013).

results.title: The Kulu valley
results.creator_credit: Chris McCullough and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into India”.
Keith Adam takes viewers on a trek through the Kulu Valley in the middle of the Himalayan Mountain Range, a fertile strip of flat land between high snow-capped mountains.

results.title: The Kremlin
results.brief_description: A guided tour of the Kremlin recreating events in Russian history associated with the building from the 12th century up until its present day role as a museum and seat of the Social Government. Shows the great halls, paintings, ikons and treasures which belonged to the Czars.
